skill.name: denario
skill.description: Multiagent AI system for scientific research assistance that automates research workflows from data analysis to publication. This skill should be used when generating research ideas from datasets, developing research methodologies, executing computational experiments, performing literature searches, or generating publication-ready papers in LaTeX format. Supports end-to-end research pipelines with customizable agent orchestration.
skill.summary: Multiagent AI system for scientific research assistance that automates research workflows from data ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing no executable code. This skill provides markdown documentation for the denario Python package. All capability descriptions reference external package installation and API usage.

content.value_statement: Scientific research requires significant time for data analysis, methodology development, and paper writing. Denario orchestrates multiple AI agents to automate the complete research pipeline from initial data exploration to publication-ready LaTeX papers.
actual_capabilities: Generate research hypotheses from dataset descriptions
Produce publication-ready LaTeX papers with journal formatting
Orchestrate multiple specialized AI agents for research tasks
Support hybrid workflows combining manual and automated stages
limitations: Requires external LLM API keys (OpenAI, Google Vertex AI)
Needs LaTeX installation or Docker for paper compilation
Automated idea quality depends on input data description quality

use_cases.title: Accelerate publication pipeline
use_cases.description: Reduce time from data analysis to submitted manuscript by automating methodology development and paper drafting.

use_cases.title: Structured research exploration
use_cases.description: Transform raw datasets into research questions, analytical methods, and written findings systematically.

use_cases.title: Learn research methodology
use_cases.description: Understand how to structure scientific investigations by reviewing AI-generated methodologies.

prompt_templates.title: Basic research start
prompt_templates.prompt: Use denario to help me analyze my dataset on [topic]. I have [data format and size]. Available tools: [list tools]. Research domain: [domain]. Start the research workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Custom methodology
prompt_templates.prompt: With denario, I want to investigate [specific research question]. My data includes [description]. Generate a methodology and execute the analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Complete pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the complete denario research pipeline: set data description as [description], generate research idea, develop methodology, execute results, and create a paper in [journal] format.

prompt_templates.title: Paper from existing results
prompt_templates.prompt: I have completed my analysis with results [brief description]. Use denario to generate a publication-ready LaTeX paper formatted for [journal] with proper sections.

output_examples.input: Help me analyze climate temperature data and generate a research paper
output: Research idea generated: Quantify long-term warming trends using time-series decomposition
Methodology created: Linear regression analysis with seasonal adjustment and significance testing
Results produced: +0.18Â°C per decade trend, statistical significance p < 0.001
Figures generated: Temperature anomaly plot, decadal averages, acceleration analysis
Paper created: Complete LaTeX manuscript with abstract, methods, results, and discussion sections

best_practices: Provide detailed data descriptions including format, size, quality issues, and available tools
Review and refine generated ideas and methodologies before proceeding to execution
Use version control to track research evolution through each pipeline stage
anti_patterns: Providing vague data descriptions without context or available tools
Skipping methodology review and accepting AI-generated approaches without validation
Using denario for complete automation without understanding or verifying the generated content

faq.question: Which LLM providers does denario support?
faq.answer: Denario supports Google Vertex AI, OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, Anthropic Claude via AG2 interfaces, and any LangGraph-compatible provider.

faq.question: What are the system requirements?
faq.answer: Python 3.12 or higher, Linux macOS or Windows, LaTeX distribution for paper generation, or Docker for containerized use.

faq.question: How does denario integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: The denario skill provides prompt templates and guidance for using the denario Python package within Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using denario?
faq.answer: Denario runs locally after package installation. Data is processed through your chosen LLM API. Review API provider privacy policies.

faq.question: Why is my generated paper not compiling?
faq.answer: Install LaTeX (texlive-full on Linux, mactex on macOS, MiKTeX on Windows) or use the Docker image with pre-installed LaTeX.

faq.question: How does denario compare to manual research?
faq.answer: Denario accelerates repetitive tasks but requires human validation. Best used as research assistant, not replacement for scientific judgment.
